title: About me
text: Hi, My name is McKay Clark. I am 24 and am a student at Brigham Young University Idaho who is trying to figure out what to study that relates to coding and computers. I’m currently looking into software engineering or web development, but I am open to the many other options offered here as well. I love to play guitar, sing, be outside and play video games. I currently work as a sales associate in the men’s department for Dillards in Idaho Falls.

title: Client Report - [Project 0]
text:
__The data that I have illustrated in the scatterplot and table bellow explores the relationship between the highway miles per gallon and the engine displacement which is the amount of air moved by the car’s cylinders wether that be in or out of it. I found a trend where, the lower the engine displacement, the higher the miles per gallon were on the highways. Towards the end of the chart, I noticed a few outliers with some of the higher displacement engines having I higher value of miles per gallon than their counterparts. Something like this may suggest that the chart may continue in an upward trend._


Show the code
mpg = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byuidatascience/data4python4ds/master/data-raw/mpg/mpg.csv")


I believe I have everything running smoothly. I uninstalled python 3.12 and reinstalled python 3.11.7 to be safe. I have no other questions at this time.

title: Client Report - [Project 0]
text:
__The data that I have illustrated in the scatterplot and table bellow explores the relationship between the highway miles per gallon and the engine displacement which is the amount of air moved by the car’s cylinders wether that be in or out of it. I found a trend where, the lower the engine displacement, the higher the miles per gallon were on the highways. Towards the end of the chart, I noticed a few outliers with some of the higher displacement engines having I higher value of miles per gallon than their counterparts. Something like this may suggest that the chart may continue in an upward trend._


Show the code
mpg = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byuidatascience/data4python4ds/master/data-raw/mpg/mpg.csv")


I believe I have everything running smoothly. I uninstalled python 3.12 and reinstalled python 3.11.7 to be safe. I have no other questions at this time.

title: Client Report - [Project 0]
text:
Manufacturer Scatterplot
It took a lot of hopping from source to source in the reading but it came to me slowly but surely. Below includes the scatterplot created in plotly which replicates the scatterplot in textbook 3.2.2.
::: {#cell-Q2 chart .cell execution_count=3}

plot example
chart = px.scatter(mpg.head(200),
    x="displ", 
    y="hwy",
    color="manufacturer"
)
chart.show()


                                                
Scatterplot

:::

title: Client Report - [Project 0]
text:
Manufacturer Markdown Table
The markdown table took quite a while for me to figure out how to render it. I needed to install tabulate to have my code generate the table. My syntax initially to install it was incorrect. after finding the correct synax I was able to move forward. The markdown table that was generated featured five of the same audi model a4 from different years. I found that the audi’s that were from earlier years like 1999 had a lower highway miles per gallon than their counterparts from 2008. This may suggest that as time has moved forward the engine displacement has gotten lower and more efficient.


table
print(mpg
  .head(5)
  .filter(["manufacturer", "model","year", "hwy"])
  .to_markdown(index=False))


| manufacturer   | model   |   year |   hwy |
|:---------------|:--------|-------:|------:|
| audi           | a4      |   1999 |    29 |
| audi           | a4      |   1999 |    29 |
| audi           | a4      |   2008 |    31 |
| audi           | a4      |   2008 |    30 |
| audi           | a4      |   1999 |    26 |

Aspiring Software Developer

datascience@byui.edu | Data Science Program | LinkedIn | GitHub



2014-2018 Rocky Mountain High-School, Meridian, ID

High-School Diploma with 3.5 GPA

Expected 2028 Brigham Young University - Idaho, Rexburg, ID

Majoring in Software Engineering




May 2018-September 2018 Car Wash Associate for Epic Shine, Meridian, ID

Worked with a team to give top of the line customer service.
Preformed janitorial services around the carwash.
Instructed people in the proper way to use an automated car wash.

2018-2020 Religious Missionary, Kansas

Studied rigorously from religious texts daily.
Taught lessons on religious topics as a team.
Attended trainings to become better missionaries.

April 2020-September 2020 Warehouse Associate for Scentsy, Meridian, ID

Tasked with Moving, packing, shipping, and restocking merchandise.
Taught to put merchandise together.

April 2021-November 2021 Security Guard for Amazon, Meridian, ID

Trained to identify threats to the facility, de-escalate potentially harmful situations, and observe and report suspicious activities to the proper authorities.
Patrolled the building every hour to regulate the environment and discourage mischief.
Trained to respond in emergency situations as an escort and administer CPR as needed.

April 2023-June 2023 Gas Station Clerk for Good 2 Go, Rigby, ID

Completed purchases for merchandise and/or gas.
Kept gas station and work area clean and tidy.
Preformed simple maintenance on machinery.

July 2023-Present Day Tailored Clothing Specialist for Dillards, Idaho Falls, ID

Help customers find what they want and need through asking questions and giving suggestions.
Teach customers about the benefits of using a Dillards credit card and gude them through the application process.
Measure customers so they are getting the right fit for them in a variety of shirts, slacks, and suits.
